item.title: Masterstroke by Infosys as it acquires minority stake in this healthcare deep-tech firm, invests Rs… - India.com
item.description:
Masterstroke by Infosys as it acquires minority stake in this healthcare deep-tech firm, invests Rs…

Publication Date: December 13, 2024

Source: India.com

Indian multinational technology company Infosys has announced an investment of Rs 8 crore (approximately USD 1.0 million) in the healthcare startup 4baseCare, aimed at enhancing its capabilities in precision oncology.

  • Infosys invests Rs 8 crore in 4baseCare through its Innovation Fund.
  • The investment aims to improve cancer diagnosis and treatment using AI and analytics.
  • 4baseCare focuses on personalized cancer therapies with a technology-driven approach.
  • Infosys holds a minority stake of up to 20% in 4baseCare.
  • This partnership marks a strategic move to collaborate with AI and DeepTech startups.
“4baseCare provides unique precision oncology solutions leveraging diverse genomic and clinical data,” Infosys stated in its regulatory filing.

The collaboration between Infosys and 4baseCare highlights a commitment to innovation in healthcare, particularly in developing advanced solutions for cancer treatment.

item.title: After Kylaq, another compact SUV is coming. More problems for Brezza, Nexon, Venue? - India Today
item.description:
After Kylaq, another compact SUV is coming. More problems for Brezza, Nexon, Venue?

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: India Today

The compact SUV segment is seeing new entrants as Kia prepares to launch its latest model, the Syros, which aims to compete with established players like Brezza, Nexon, and Venue. The global debut is scheduled for December 19, 2024.

  • The Kia Syros is the third SUV from Kia India, following the Seltos and Sonet.
  • It will feature a boxy design with a bold grille and vertically stacked LED headlights.
  • The upcoming SUV includes advanced safety features, such as ADAS and a 360-degree camera.
  • Powertrain options are expected to include a 1.0-litre turbo petrol engine and a 1.5-litre diesel engine.
  • The expected price range for the Syros is between Rs 9 lakh and Rs 17 lakh (ex-showroom).

“The Syros will compete against the Maruti Suzuki Brezza, Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, Skoda Kylaq and Mahindra XUV 3X0.”

The introduction of the Kia Syros could significantly shake up the compact SUV market, posing a challenge to existing models with its feature-rich design and competitive pricing.

item.title: Indian-origin CEO thinks he should ‘get a green card’, Elon Musk reacts with one-word answer - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian-origin CEO thinks he should ‘get a green card’, Elon Musk reacts with one-word answer

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Billionaire Elon Musk reacted to an X post by Aravind Srinivas, the Indian-origin CEO of Perplexity AI, regarding his long wait for a green card. Musk's single-word response of "Yes" has gained significant attention on social media.

  • Aravind Srinivas expressed his desire to obtain a green card on X, asking, “I think I should get a green card. Wdyt?”
  • Elon Musk replied simply with "Yes", attracting widespread interest.
  • Srinivas responded to Musk with a red heart emoji and a folded hands emoji.
  • Srinivas is the CEO of Perplexity AI, an AI-powered search engine founded in 2022.
"We have an upside down system that makes it hard for highly talented people to come to America legally, but trivial for criminals to come here illegally." - Elon Musk

The conversation highlights ongoing discussions about immigration policy and its impact on talented individuals in the tech industry. Srinivas, an IIT Madras graduate and former research scientist at OpenAI, has garnered attention for his contributions to AI despite challenges in obtaining citizenship.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment: GMP At 24.36%, A Step-By-Step Guide To Check Allotment Status Online - News18
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment: GMP At 24.36%, A Step-By-Step Guide To Check Allotment Status Online

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

Vishal Mega Mart's IPO is generating significant interest with a strong subscription performance, set to finalize allotment on December 16, and listing on December 18.

  • The IPO was open for subscription from December 11 to December 13, with a total subscription of 28.75 times.
  • Retail investors subscribed 2.43 times, non-institutional investors 15.01 times, and qualified institutional buyers 85.11 times.
  • The IPO price band was set at Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share.
  • Unlisted shares are currently trading at Rs 97, reflecting a premium of 24.36%.
  • Allotment confirmation expected by the evening of December 16; shares will list on BSE and NSE on December 18.

"The GMP has shown steady growth, increasing from the 20.51 per cent recorded at the IPO’s outset."

The Vishal Mega Mart IPO has attracted considerable investor interest, reflected in its subscription rates and GMP, indicating a promising outlook for its market debut.

item.title: MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates - News18
item.description:
MobiKwik IPO: Know Latest GMP, Allotment, and Listing Dates

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

The much-anticipated initial public offering (IPO) of MobiKwik has concluded with impressive subscription numbers and is set for a strong market debut on December 18.

  • The IPO was open for bidding from December 11 to December 13.
  • The IPO received an overwhelming subscription rate of 125.69 times overall, with retail investors at 141.78 times, NIIs at 114.7 times, and QIBs at 125.82 times.
  • MobiKwik’s unlisted shares are currently trading at Rs 444, which is 59.14% higher than the upper price band of Rs 279.
  • The allotment will be finalised on December 16, with listing on the BSE and NSE scheduled for December 18.
  • The total size of the public issue is Rs 572 crore, consisting entirely of fresh equity shares.
“As of today, MobiKwik’s unlisted shares are trading at Rs 444 per share, which is Rs 165 or 59.14% higher than the upper price band of Rs 279, signaling a strong debut on December 18.”

Founded by Bipin Preet Singh and Upasana Taku, MobiKwik aims to solidify its position in India’s fintech ecosystem with this IPO.

item.title: Upcoming dividend, bonus issue, share splits: PC Jeweller among 9 stocks with ex/record date this week – List - ET Now
item.description:
Upcoming dividend, bonus issue, share splits: PC Jeweller among 9 stocks with ex/record date this week – List

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: ET NOW DIGITAL

Several listed companies are set to reward their shareholders this week, including PC Jeweller, as nine stocks will have their ex/record dates for dividends, bonus issues, or stock splits.

  • As many as 9 shares will go ex-date this week.
  • PC Jeweller is one among those that will trade ex-date.
  • Linc stock will go ex-date for a bonus issue and a share split.
“Record date helps companies identify who will be entitled to receive benefits such as dividends, stock splits, or bonus shares.”

This week’s ex-dates include significant movements like PC Jeweller's stock split and multiple companies issuing dividends, emphasizing the importance of timing for shareholders looking to gain benefits.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO: Check GMP, Allotment Date, Subscription Status - News18
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO: Check GMP, Allotment Date, Subscription Status

Publication Date: December 14, 2024, 16:35 IST

Source: News18

Unlisted shares of Vishal Mega Mart Ltd are currently trading at Rs 97 per share in the grey market, which is 24.36 per cent higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 78, indicating a decent listing on December 18.

  • The IPO allotment will be finalised on December 16, and the listing on BSE and NSE will occur on December 18.
  • The IPO was available for subscription between December 11 and December 13, receiving an overall subscription of 28.75 times.
  • The retail category saw a 2.43 times subscription, while non-institutional investors portion had a 15.01 times subscription.
  • Qualified institutional buyers subscribed by 85.11 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) is currently at 24.36%, indicating solid market interest.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

The IPO of Vishal Mega Mart is entirely an offer-for-sale (OFS) by promoter Kedaara Capital-led Samayat Services LLP, with no fresh issue of equity shares. The IPO collected Rs 2,400 crore from anchor investors before the IPO’s public offering.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Highlights: Issue booked 27.28x led by QIBs, NIIs. Check GMP, review, more | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Highlights: Issue booked 27.28x led by QIBs, NIIs. Check GMP, review, more

Publication Date: 13 Dec, 2024 | Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

Vishal Mega Mart's IPO, valued at ₹8,000 crore, saw significant interest with a subscription rate of 27.28 times on its third day, primarily from Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) and Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs).

  • The IPO was fully subscribed on the second day, achieving a rate of 1.54 times.
  • The retail investor segment saw a subscription of 2.31 times, while NIIs subscribed at 14.25 times.
  • QIBs led the charge with a staggering 80.75 times subscription rate.
  • Vishal Mega Mart aims for a market valuation of approximately ₹36,120 crore if shares are priced at ₹78.
  • The price band for the IPO is between ₹74 and ₹78 per equity share.
  • The supermarket chain is focused on growth in tier-2 cities with plans to expand its retail presence across India.
"The IPO offers an attractive valuation at 76x FY24 PE, making it relatively affordable compared to industry peers." - Gaurav Garg, Research Analyst at Lemonn Markets Desk.

This robust response from investors highlights growing confidence in Vishal Mega Mart’s potential amidst a dynamic retail landscape. The IPO has attracted significant attention and is seen as a promising opportunity for investors.

item.title: Bihari sattu roti to Manipur's black rice pudding: Recreate Vikas Khanna's Bungalow menu for Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bihari sattu roti to Manipur's black rice pudding: Recreate Vikas Khanna's Bungalow menu for Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez

Date: Dec 14, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Amazon's Jeff Bezos recently dined at Vikas Khanna's Michelin-star restaurant, Bungalow, in New York, where he experienced a carefully curated desi fusion meal with partner Lauren Sanchez, describing it as a 'pilgrimage'.

  • The meal featured a variety of dishes, including Bengali Kasundi Tandoori Avocado and Indore-inspired Dahi Kebab.
  • Notable desserts included Gulab Jamun ice cream paired with millet chocolate cake.
  • The article provides recipes for three dishes: Bihari Sattu Roti, Indore's Dahi Kebabs, and Black Rice Pudding from Manipur.
A 'pilgrimage' — that's what Jeff Bezos called Vikas Khanna's carefully curated desi fusion meal for him and partner Lauren Sanchez.

Overall, the menu reflects a blend of traditional Indian flavors with innovative techniques, inviting readers to recreate this unique dining experience at home.

item.title: "To Me, It's A Black Mark": KM Birla On Losing "Cool" 18 Times In 29 Years - NDTV
item.description:
To Me, It's A Black Mark: KM Birla On Losing "Cool" 18 Times In 29 Years

Publication Date: Not Specified
Source: Not Specified

Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath interviews Kumar Mangalam Birla, the chairman of Aditya Birla Group, in the upcoming episode of his podcast 'People By WTF', where Birla reveals he has lost his cool 18 times in 29 years.

  • Nikhil Kamath will host Kumar Mangalam Birla in his podcast series.
  • Birla admits to losing his temper 18 times in nearly three decades.
  • The podcast episode is expected to cover various topics of interest.
  • Birla references the limited availability of his interviews over the years.
  • Social media users express excitement for the upcoming episode.
"I have lost it 18 times in 29 years. To me, it is a black mark, especially at work." - Kumar Mangalam Birla

As anticipation builds for the podcast episode, it offers a rare glimpse into the thoughts of one of India's business titans.

item.title: Section of Akasa Air pilots flags concerns over unfair practices; airline terms allegations untrue - The Economic Times
item.description:
Section of Akasa Air pilots flags concerns over unfair practices; airline terms allegations untrue

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024, 09:01:00 PM IST

Source: PTI

A section of Akasa Air pilots has raised concerns about alleged training and safety issues at the airline and sought the intervention of the civil aviation ministry, while the carrier termed the allegations as untrue.

  • Akasa Air faces allegations of training lapses and safety issues, with pilots requesting a probe.
  • The airline disputes these claims, stating that 324 pilots have joined since October 2023 and attrition is below 1%.
  • 84 pilots reportedly resigned on short notice, prompting concerns among remaining staff.
  • The DGCA imposed a Rs 30 lakh fine on Akasa Air for previous training lapses.
  • The airline operates 26 planes and serves 27 destinations, including five overseas cities.
"We categorically deny these allegations as baseless and untrue. Nor do they represent the views of Akasa pilots," - Airline spokesperson.

Despite the concerns raised, Akasa Air maintains that its monthly employee surveys indicate high job satisfaction among pilots, countering the allegations about unfair practices.

item.title: 415% up in 2024! Multibagger pump stock bags Rs 754 cr order - is it in your portfolio? - ET Now
item.description:
415% up in 2024! Multibagger pump stock bags Rs 754 cr order - is it in your portfolio?

Updated Dec 14, 2024, 20:09 IST

Shakti Pumps (India) Ltd. has secured a significant order worth Rs 754.30 crore, reflecting a remarkable growth in its stock value, which increased by 415% in 2024.

  • Shakti Pumps (India) Ltd. has bagged a big order amounting to Rs 754.30 crore from Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) for 25,000 solar pumping systems.
  • Following the announcement of the order, shares of Shakti Pumps hit the 5 per cent upper circuit, closing at Rs 886.70 on BSE.
  • The company has invested Rs. 4 crore in its subsidiary, Shakti Energy Solutions Private Limited.
"Under this Letter of Empanelment from MSEDCL, the company will receive a series of orders...with a total value of Rs. 754.30 Crores (inclusive of GST)."

The stock has shown phenomenal performance with returns of 1160% over two years and 2494% over five years, marking it as a significant player in the market.

item.title: SARFAESI | Confirmed Sale Can't Be Set Aside For Mere Irregularities Except Fraud, Collusion, Inadequate... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
SARFAESI | Confirmed Sale Can't Be Set Aside For Mere Irregularities Except Fraud, Collusion, Inadequate...

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court recently clarified the grounds under which a sale of property under the SARFAESI Act can be challenged after confirmation, emphasizing that only fundamental errors like fraud or collusion are valid reasons for setting aside a sale.

  • The Court held that procedural irregularities alone cannot invalidate a confirmed sale.
  • Only substantial procedural errors such as fraud, collusion, or inadequate pricing warrant intervention.
  • Legal challenges should ideally be raised before the confirmation of the sale.
  • The judgment referenced V.S. Palanivel v. P. Sriram, reinforcing that courts should avoid setting aside auctions unless serious flaws are identified.
  • The case involved a minor procedural point regarding the gap between sale and auction notices, which was insufficient for a successful challenge.
"Any sale by auction or other public procurement methods once already confirmed or concluded ought not to be set-aside or interfered with lightly except on grounds that go to the core of such sale process, such as either being collusive, fraudulent or vitiated by inadequate pricing or underbidding."

In conclusion, the Supreme Court reinforced the stability of confirmed sales under the SARFAESI Act, allowing challenges only in cases of significant procedural shortcomings. This ruling aims to maintain confidence in auction processes and avoid unnecessary disruptions.

item.title: AI should not be outrightly rejected: Supreme Court Justice KV Viswanathan - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
AI should not be outrightly rejected: Supreme Court Justice KV Viswanathan

Published on: 14 Dec 2024, 11:51 am

Supreme Court judge Justice KV Viswanathan emphasized the importance of considering the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in society, stating that it should not be outrightly rejected during a recent event.

  • Justice Viswanathan spoke at the Delhi High Court during the launch of a commentary on Patent Law by advocate Adarsh Ramanujan.
  • He highlighted the commentary's intriguing analysis of AI's relationship with patent law.
  • Justice Manmohan also attended, noting an increase in patent applications at the Indian Patent Office as an encouraging trend.
  • The event included discussions on the significance of identifying invention origins through patenting and the need for better training for patent examiners.

“I don't think that AI should be outrightly rejected. It calls for a certain amount of thought before we take a final call on it,” - Justice KV Viswanathan.

“Patent law is where future lies. It is a growing field that puts the lawyer first,” - Justice Manmohan.

This discussion reflects a growing recognition of the potential and challenges of integrating AI into legal frameworks, while also encouraging innovation in patent law practices in India.
